intro: Thapsia garganica var. decussata, commonly known as the Garganica thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain parts of southern Italy.
